Uses of Class
nitf.NITFObject

Uses of NITFObject in nitf
 

Subclasses of NITFObject in nitf
 class BandInfo
          A representation of the image band information that is recorded in the NITF image subheader.
 class BandSource
          Represents a source of an image band
 class BlockingInfo
          A representation of the blocking information used in the library.
 class CloneableObject
          This class is a NITFObject that can be cloned.
 class ComponentInfo
          A representation of the component information found in the NITF File Header.
 class DESegment
          A representation of the NITF Data Extension Segment.
 class DestructibleObject
          Class representing a NITF object that has underlying memory that can be independently destructed.
 class DESubheader
          A representation of the NITF Data Extension subheader
 class DownSampler
          DownSampler The abstract DownSampler class.
 class Extensions
          A representation of an extensions segment in the NITF specification.
 class Field
          A Field corresponds to the data and basic information regarding a NITF field.
 class FieldWarning
          This class represents a Warning that is created by the NITF system while processing the data in some way.
 class FileHeader
          Represents the NITF file header

In NITF, the file header is the first section of a file (before the image subheaders).
 class FileSecurity
          A representation of the NITF security information.
 class FileSource
          FileSource The FileSource class extends the BandSource class, allowing you to provide data from an IOHandle.
 class GraphicSegment
          A representation of the NITF Graphic (Symobl) Segment
 class GraphicSubheader
          A representation of the NITF Graphic (Symobl) subheader
 class ImageReader
          Class that has the functionality of reading an image
 class ImageSegment
          A representation of the NITF Image Segment

The image segment corresponds to each image plus its subheader which exists in the NITF file.
 class ImageSource
          Class used to compile an image together, based on its constituent bands.
 class ImageSubheader
          A representation of the NITF Image subheader

The ImageSubheader component represents the NITF file image subheader from the NITF file.
 class ImageWriter
          The handle that gives access to writing images
 class IOHandle
          A representation of a handle to a file object.
 class LabelSegment
          A representation of the NITF Label segment
 class LabelSubheader
          A representation of the NITF Label subheader
 class LookupTable
          Represents a LookupTable used in the BandInfo object
 class MaxDownSampler
          MaxDownSampler The maxDownSample selects the maximum pixel

The row and column skip factors divide the sub-window into non-overlaping sample windows.
 class MemorySource
          MemorySource The MemorySource class extends the BandSource class, allowing you to provide data from a memory buffer.
 class PixelSkipDownSampler
          PixelSkipDownSampler The pixelSkip down-sampler has a designated skip value in the row and column, and it skips data in between.
 class PluginRegistry
          PluginRegistry This class provides an entrypoint to loading plugins
 class Reader
          An object that reads and parses a NITF file
 class Record
          Represents a NITF record

The Record object is a database-like record of the fields in a NITF file.
 class RESegment
          A representation of the NITF Reserved Extensions segment
 class RESubheader
          A representation of the NITF Reserved Extensions subheader
 class SegmentReader
          SegmentReader

This class provides a "jailed" IOHandle to the data in a segment.
 class SegmentSource
          Represents a source of an image band
 class SegmentWriter
          The handle that gives access to writing segments
 class SubWindow
          An object that contains information for reading image data.
 class SumSq2BandDownSampler
          SumSq2BandDownSampler Sum of square, two band, down-sample method The maximum is calculated as the sum of the sum of squares of two bands.
 class TextSegment
          A representation of the NITF Text segment
 class TextSubheader
          A representation of the NITF Text subheader
 class TRE
          A representation of the NITF Tagged Record Extensions (TRE)
 class Writer
          Writes NITF files
